report.name: lvl1_loops_coverage
report.text: Too little time of the experiment time spent in analyzed loops (0.47%)
report.desc: If the time spent in analyzed loops is less than 30%, standard loop optimizations will have a limited impact on application performances.

report.name: lvl1_activity_ratio
report.desc: CPU cores are active 97.34% of time

report.name: lvl1_active_threads
report.desc: On average, more than 97.34% of observed threads are actually active

report.name: lvl1_affinity_stability
report.desc: Threads are not migrating to CPU cores: probably successfully pinned

report.name: lvl1_is_flat_profile
report.desc: No hotspot found in the application (greatest loop coverage is 0.26%), and the twenty hottest loops cumulated coverage is lower than 20% of the application profiled time (0.47%)

report.name: lvl1_innermost_loops_coverage
report.text: Too little time of the experiment time spent in analyzed innermost loops (0.47%)
report.desc: If the time spent in analyzed innermost loops is less than 15%, standard innermost loop optimizations such as vectorisation will have a limited impact on application performances.

report.name: lvl1_is_more_innermost_than_other
report.text: Cumulative Outermost/In between loops coverage (0.00%) lower than cumulative innermost loop coverage (0.47%)
report.desc: Having cumulative Outermost/In between loops coverage greater than cumulative innermost loop coverage will make loop optimization more complex

report.name: lvl1_blas1
report.text: Less than 10% (0.00%) is spend in BLAS1 operations
report.desc: It could be more efficient to inline by hand BLAS1 operations

report.name: lvl1_blas2
report.text: Less than 10% (0.00%) is spend in BLAS2 operations
report.desc: BLAS2 calls usually could make a poor cache usage and could benefit from inlining.

report.name: lvl1_libm_usage
report.text: Less than 10% (0.00%) is spend in Libm/SVML (special functions)
